meanings.definition: A heading or title that comes after the main heading or title.
meanings.sent1: The subheads in the article helped me understand the main points better.
meanings.sent2: The subheads in the book chapters made it easier to navigate through the content.
meanings.sent3: I chuckled when I saw the subheads trying to outshine the main title.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like subheads, adding depth and clarity to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The subheads acted as signposts, guiding readers through the text smoothly.

meanings.definition: A smaller headline within a larger piece of text.
meanings.sent1: The subheads in the newspaper article highlighted key points effectively.
meanings.sent2: When writing an essay, it's important to use subheads to organize your thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The subheads in the story seemed to gossip about the main headline.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a subhead, drawing attention to his friendly nature.
meanings.sent5: The subheads were like breadcrumbs, leading the reader through the text step by step.
